name: NPR
text: Only a few hours left before Giving Tuesday is over. Make sure you do your part to support the journalism that matters to you by donating to your local NPR station. https://t.co/LzgHFrLiTo https://t.co/wFSonnNWTu

name: NPR
text:
Kurt Papenfus is the lone full-time emergency room doctor in the town of 900, not far from the Kansas line. 

His illness is a test case for how the pandemic is affecting the fragile rural healthcare system. https://t.co/Aq9AlanPGx

name: NPR
text: RT @EmilyZFeng: A few weeks ago I met the man who delivers my many Taobao packages. He was terrified. It was then that I began learning about the demanding, mobile app-tracked life of China’s 3 million delivery workers https://t.co/U2zkT90dQR

name: NPR
text:
Eastern Europe's populist leaders — particularly the increasingly authoritarian governments of Hungary and Poland — are having a hard time accepting that President Trump lost.
 https://t.co/Fob6o3Qu5K

name: NPR
text:
The Arecibo Observatory has collapsed. 

Once the world's largest single-dish radio telescope, it was used to detect the first binary pulsar in 1974 — a discovery that bolstered a key idea in Einstein's general theory of relativity.
https://t.co/6vOCtsFAEL

name: NPR
text:
NEW: The Justice Dept. is investigating a possible secret scheme involving a bribe in exchange for a presidential pardon, according to heavily redacted court documents unsealed Tuesday.
https://t.co/777NBo6Agp

name: NPR
text:
A new report suggests, on average, online learning in the pandemic has had little impact on kids' reading growth and has only somewhat slowed gains in math.

But a worrying caveat: Many of the nation's most vulnerable students are missing from the data.
https://t.co/Xs6D2pFULE
